WorkItem.Description:
On two different Windows Vista PC's, as soon as I run the Client Profile Configuration tool, it immidately crashes with no error messages and just the standard Windows error dialog.
 
The problems and solutions control panel has the following information about one of the crashes:

WorkItem.Summary: Client Profile Configuration Designer Crashes on launch

Comments.Message:
I've blogged about this and several of my readers have confirmed they have the same problem.   It seems that the EXE has a dependency on an assembly that's not in the installer.

http://blog.deploymentengineering.com/2008/11/horrible-setup-experience-for-client.html

The error is "Strong name validation failed" and fuslogvw doesn't show any binding errors, so it's obviously not a missing dependency issue.

The problem may be that MS used partial signing and deployed the partially-signed assembly.

The solution is to disable strong-name verification in a VS command prompt as follows:

sn -Vr "C:\Program Files\Microsoft Client Profile Configuration Designer\cpdesign.exe"

Obviously replace the path to cpdesign.exe if it's different on your system.

Hi folks,

We discovered an issue with the signing of the binaries and are working to resolve this issue as soon as possible. Apologies for the inconvenience.

Thanks,
-Bart
This bug appears to of been fixed for me anyway in release: 14962
